content:
TITLE: Installing Primer Brand React Package DESCRIPTION: Command to install the @primer/react-brand package using npm package manager. This is required to use Primer Brand React components in your project. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-12_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm install @primer/react-brand ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Buttons with Icons in JSX DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add icons to the Button component using the 'leadingVisual' and 'trailingVisual' props. It's recommended to use Octicons for the icons. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Button/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring ThemeProvider in React DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to wrap a React application with the ThemeProvider component from Primer Brand to enable theming functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/theming.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import {ThemeProvider} from '@primer/react-brand' function App() { return (
...
 ) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Hero Component with Images in React DESCRIPTION: Shows how to include images in the Hero component and demonstrates different image positioning options. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Hero/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` <> Actions Automate your workflow from idea to production Get started with Actions
Actions Automate your workflow from idea to production Get started with Actions ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interactive Stack Alignment Example in React DESCRIPTION: A complex example showing how to use Stack with adjustable alignment props. It includes form controls to dynamically change alignItems and justifyContent values. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Stack/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const App = () => { const [alignItemsValue, setAlignItemsValue] = React.useState('center') const [justifyContentValue, setJustifyContentValue] = React.useState('space-between') const handleMainAxisChange = (event) => setJustifyContentValue(event.target.value) const handleCrossAxisChange = (event) => setAlignItemsValue(event.target.value) return ( Main axis Cross axis ) } render(App) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Primer Brand Package DESCRIPTION: Install the Primer Brand package using npm package manager SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/introduction.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm install @primer/react-brand ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring ThemeProvider in React DESCRIPTION: Basic setup of ThemeProvider component wrapping a React application root to enable theming functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/getting-started/theming.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import {ThemeProvider} from '@primer/react-brand' function App() { return (
...
 ) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: FormControl with Validation DESCRIPTION: A controlled form example demonstrating validation with FormControl. Shows how to implement validation logic that provides feedback to users, handles form submission, and focuses invalid inputs to guide users to errors. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/FormControl.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const App = () => { const inputRef = React.useRef(null) const [value, setValue] = React.useState('mona lisa') const [isValid, setIsValid] = React.useState(false) const onChange = (e) => setValue(e.target.value) const onSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault() const valid = !value.includes(' ') setIsValid(valid) if (!valid) { inputRef.current.focus() } } return (
GitHub handle {isValid && ( Valid name )} {!isValid && ( GitHub handles cannot contain spaces.{' '} {value && `Did you mean "${value.replaceAll(' ', '')}"`} )}
) } render(App) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning and Setting Up Primer Brand Repository in Git DESCRIPTION: Instructions for cloning the Primer Brand repository, creating a feature branch, and installing dependencies. This snippet outlines the initial steps for contributing to the project. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-12_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. Clone [this repository](https://github.com/primer/brand). 1. Create a new feature branch: `git checkout -b my-handle/my-branch-name`. 1. Configure and install the dependencies: `npm install` 1. Make your changes and commit them. 1. Create a changeset for your changes if your contribution affects distributed code: `npx changeset` - See [changesets/changesets](https://github.com/changesets/changesets) for more information. 1. Push your branch and open a pull request. **Please use the supplied pull request template**. 1. Wait for CI tests to complete. - If the tests pass, you should see a status check advising you that a canary build of `@primer/react-brand` has been published, and ready to test in-app. - If the tests fail, review the logs and address any issues. - If the builds fail for any other reason (as they occasionally do), they may need to be manually restarted. 1. Pat yourself on the back and wait for your pull request to be reviewed. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Animate Component with AnimationProvider in React DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the Animate component wrapped in an AnimationProvider to apply a fade-in animation to a Text component. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/animation.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` This text will fade-in ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing ThemeProvider DESCRIPTION: Setup the ThemeProvider component at the root of the React application for proper theming SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/introduction.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import {ThemeProvider} from '@primer/react-brand' function App() { return (
...
 ) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complex Form Layout Using FormControl DESCRIPTION: An extensive example of a form layout composed using FormControl components, demonstrating how to build a complete form with various inputs, hint text, and validation requirements. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/FormControl.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ```
All fields marked with an asterisk (*) are required Title First name Last name Enterprise name Enterprise URL Country Contact me about GitHub Enterprise Server I'm interested in learning more about{' '} GitHub Enterprise Server {' '} and would like to be contacted by GitHub's sales team. Captcha I hereby accept the{' '} GitHub Customer Agreement {' '} on behalf of my organization and confirm that I have the authority to do so. For more information about GitHub's privacy practices, see the{' '} GitHub Privacy Statement. {' '}
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Hero Component Example DESCRIPTION: Example implementation of the Hero component with various sub-components and content SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/introduction.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Label This is my super sweet hero heading Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In sapien sit ullamcorper id. Aliquam luctus sed turpis felis nam pulvinar risus elementum. Primary action Secondary action ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Primer Brand with npm DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Primer Brand package using npm. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/getting-started/index.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm install @primer/react-brand ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interactive Color Mode Example DESCRIPTION: Complete example showing dynamic color mode switching with state management and UI components. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/getting-started/theming.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const Example = () => { const [colorMode, setColorMode] = React.useState() const handleChange = (event) => { event.preventDefault() setColorMode('dark') } return ( Heading Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In sapien sit ullamcorper id. Aliquam luctus sed turpis felis nam pulvinar risus elementum. {colorMode === 'dark' ? "I'm in dark mode now" : 'Switch to dark mode'} ) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Primer Brand CSS Stylesheet DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to import the main CSS stylesheet from Primer Brand, which contains design tokens, component styles, and a CSS reset. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/theming.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import '@primer/react-brand/lib/css/main.css' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Default Hero Component in React DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic usage of the Hero component with its subcomponents including label, heading, description, and action buttons. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Hero/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Label This is my super sweet hero heading Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In sapien sit ullamcorper id. Aliquam luctus sed turpis felis nam pulvinar risus elementum. Primary action Secondary action ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Icons with Different Sizes in JSX DESCRIPTION: Shows how to render icons in different sizes using the size prop. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Icon.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing PricingOptions with Feature List Sets in React DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to create a pricing comparison with grouped feature lists using PricingOptions component. Demonstrates implementation of two pricing tiers with base features and security sections. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/PricingOptions.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Copilot Individual Code completions, Chat, and more for indie developers and freelancers. 10 Base features Code completions Chat in IDE and Mobile CLI assistance Security Security vulnerability filter Free for verified students, teachers, and maintainers of popular open source projects. Start a free trial Recommended Copilot Business Copilot personalized to your organization. 19 Buy now Contact sales Base features Everything in Copilot Individual Code referencing Security Security vulnerability filter Public code filter IP indemnity Enterprise-grade security, safety, and privacy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing and Using Primer Brand Components in React DESCRIPTION: Example of importing and using a Primer Brand component (Hero) in a React application. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/getting-started/index.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` import {Hero} from '@primer/react-brand' ``` LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Responsive Stack Configuration in React DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the Stack component with responsive props. Different values are set for direction, gap, padding, alignItems, and justifyContent at various breakpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Stack/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering CheckboxGroup with Validation in React DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to add validation states (success and error) to the CheckboxGroup. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/CheckboxGroup/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Valid selection Option one Option two Great choice! Invalid selection Option one Option two Please select at least one option ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using ThemeProvider in React Application DESCRIPTION: Example of wrapping the root of a React application with the ThemeProvider component for proper theming. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/getting-started/index.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` import {ThemeProvider} from '@primer/react-brand' function App() { return (
...
 ) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Color Mode Switching with ThemeProvider DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use ThemeProvider to implement color mode switching between light and dark modes using React state. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/theming.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const Example = () => { const [colorMode, setColorMode] = React.useState() const handleChange = event => { event.preventDefault() setColorMode('dark') } return ( Heading Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In sapien sit ullamcorper id. Aliquam luctus sed turpis felis nam pulvinar risus elementum. {colorMode === 'dark' ? "I'm in dark mode now" : 'Switch to dark mode'} ) } render(Example) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CTA Form with Event Handlers DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to implement event handlers with the CTA Form component, including onChange for input changes and onSubmit for form submission. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/CTAForm/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` alert('onSubmit event triggered')}> console.log('onChange event triggered')}> Your work email address Subscribe ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combining Icon and Label in Card Component in JSX DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to combine both Icon and Label in a Card component for added context and metadata. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Card/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Beta Code search & code view Enables you to rapidly search, navigate, and understand code, right from GitHub.com. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Uncontrolled FormControl with Ref Usage in React DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement an uncontrolled form using FormControl with ref forwarding. Includes form submission handling and value access through refs. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/FormControl.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const App = () => { const inputRef = React.useRef(null) const handleSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault() if (inputRef.current) { alert(`Name: ${inputRef.current.value}`) } } return (
Name
) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default RadioGroup Implementation DESCRIPTION: Example of a basic RadioGroup implementation with multiple radio options. All radio inputs share the same 'name' prop to function as a group. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/RadioGroup/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Choose your primary workspace Codespaces Local environment Pen and paper ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Pagination Implementation DESCRIPTION: Example showing a default implementation of the Pagination component with state management and page change handling. Demonstrates handling next, previous, and direct page navigation. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Pagination.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const App = () => { const [currentPage, setCurrentPage] = React.useState(5) const totalPages = 10 const handlePageChange = (e, pageNumber) => { if (pageNumber === currentPage + 1 && currentPage < totalPages) { // Next page handler setCurrentPage(currentPage + 1) } else if (pageNumber === currentPage - 1 && currentPage > 1) { // Previous page handler setCurrentPage(currentPage - 1) } else if (pageNumber >= 1 && pageNumber <= totalPages) { setCurrentPage(pageNumber) } } return ( ) } render() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Default PricingOptions Component in React DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the default usage of the PricingOptions component with two pricing plans. It includes labels, headings, descriptions, prices, feature lists, and action buttons for each plan. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/PricingOptions.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: JSX CODE: ``` Recommended Copilot Copilot in the coding environment. 10 Everything in Copilot Business plus: Chat in IDE and Mobile CLI assistance Code completions Buy now Contact sales Recommended Copilot Business Copilot personalized to your organization throughout the software development lifecycle. Requires GitHub Enterprise Cloud. 39 Everything in Copilot Business plus: Chat in IDE and Mobile CLI assistance Code completions Join waitlist ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Responsive Bento Implementation with Breakpoint Objects DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement responsive Bento layouts using breakpoint-specific objects for properties like columnSpan, rowSpan, and rowStart. This creates a layout that adapts to different screen sizes. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Bento.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CTABanner with Custom Background Color DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates setting a subtle background color on the CTABanner and disabling the shadow. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/CTABanner/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Where the most ambitious teams build great things Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In sapien sit ullamcorper id. Aliquam luctus sed turpis felis nam pulvinar risus elementum. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interactive Animation Demo Implementation DESCRIPTION: A complete example showing how to implement interactive animations with state management and user controls. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/getting-started/animation.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const App = () => { const [animationVariant, setAnimationVariant] = React.useState('fade-in') const handleAnimationChange = (event) => setAnimationVariant(event.target.value) return ( Animation ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TextInput Variants Grid Implementation DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates various input types including text, number, email, password, month, telephone, time, date, datetime-local, and URL within a grid layout using FormControl. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/TextInput.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Text (default) Number Email Password Month Telephone Time Date Date (local) URL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Usage of Stack Component in React DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the default usage of the Stack component with Heading and Text children. The Stack is used to arrange content vertically. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Stack/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Code search & code view Enables you to rapidly search, navigate, and understand code, right from GitHub.com. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Responsive Grid Layout DESCRIPTION: Implements responsive grid behavior using breakpoint-specific span values. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Grid/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Responsive Stack Configuration in React DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to use the Stack component with responsive properties for direction, gap, padding, alignItems, and justifyContent across different breakpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/components/Stack/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Primer Brand Global Stylesheet in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Import statement for loading the main Primer Brand stylesheet when using an application bundler like Webpack. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/getting-started/index.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` import '@primer/react-brand/lib/css/main.css' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Custom FAQ Toggle Colors with ThemeProvider DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to customize FAQ.Question toggle colors using the toggleColor prop and custom CSS styles in a dark theme context. Shows implementation of a FAQ component with custom green-blue gradient colors for toggles. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/FAQ/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const App = () => { const customStyles = ` .custom-heading { background: linear-gradient(271.72deg, var(--brand-Accordion-toggle-color-green-blue-start) 7.09%, var(--brand-Accordion-toggle-color-green-blue-end) 96.61%); -webkit-background-clip: text; background-clip: text; -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent; } ` return ( Frequently asked questions Subscriptions & Payments What are the differences between GitHub Free, GitHub Pro, GitHub Team and GitHub Enterprise plans?

GitHub Free is our basic plan created for individuals and small teams to collaborate on private and public repositories.

How do I view and manage my subscription?

You can view your account's subscription, your other paid features and products, and your next billing date in your account's billing settings.

How can I change my GitHub subscription?

You can upgrade or downgrade your subscription, add and remove seats, or change the billing cadence on https://github.com/settings/billing.

) } render() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Default Button Group in JSX DESCRIPTION: Example of the default variant for the ButtonGroup component with a primary and secondary button. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/ButtonGroup/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Full LogoSuite with Heading, Description, and Logos in React DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates a complete LogoSuite implementation with a heading, description, and logo bar containing SVG company logos (GitHub, Microsoft, LinkedIn). The component creates a branded section that showcases company logos with accompanying text. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/LogoSuite/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` The ultimate developer experience is here. Trusted by the world's leading organizations ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Checkbox Usage with FormControl DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates different states of checkboxes including default, checked, unchecked, and disabled states using FormControl for proper accessibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Checkbox/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ```
Default checkbox Always checked Always unchecked Inactive
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: SubNav with Dropdown Submenu DESCRIPTION: Implementation showing how to add a dropdown submenu to a SubNav link, which displays additional navigation options when the parent link is interacted with. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/SubNav.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Features Actions Actions feature one Actions feature two Actions feature three Actions feature four Packages Copilot Code review ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Grouped FAQ Implementation DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to group multiple FAQ sections using FAQGroup component with custom tab attributes for analytics SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/FAQ/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ({ 'data-analytics': `faq-tab-${i}`, })} > Frequently asked
questions Using GitHub Enterprise [...] About GitHub Enterprise [...] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Grid Layout DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic 12-column grid layout system with various column spans. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Grid/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CTABanner with Background Image DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add a background image to the CTABanner component with responsive image sources for different viewport widths. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/CTABanner/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Where the most ambitious teams build great things Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. In sapien sit ullamcorper id. Aliquam luctus sed turpis felis nam pulvinar risus elementum. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: River Component with Duotone Style DESCRIPTION: Example of River component with duotone styling and simplified content structure SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/River/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` This first sentence is highlighted and here is where the body copy starts. Remember to keep this nice and succinct. Call to action ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Uncontrolled TextInput with Ref Implementation DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use TextInput in uncontrolled mode with refs for form submission handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/TextInput.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const App = () => { const inputRef = React.useRef(null) const handleSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault() if (!inputRef.current.value) { alert(`Enter a value and try again.`) return } alert(`Name: ${inputRef.current.value}`) } return (
Name
) } render(App) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Animating Cards with Staggering in React DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the Animate component to apply scale-in-up animations to Card components within a Grid, utilizing automatic staggering provided by AnimationProvider. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/animation.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Limited Collaboration is the key to DevOps success Everything you need to know about getting started with GitHub Actions. Limited GitHub Actions cheat sheet and more In a recent study, 70% of organizations reported they had adopted DevOps. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessible Icon Tooltip Implementation DESCRIPTION: Implementation showing how to use the Tooltip component with an icon button, providing accessibility through the type prop set to label. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Tooltip.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default CTA Form Implementation with Confirmation Checkbox DESCRIPTION: Example showing the complete CTA Form with an email input field and a confirmation checkbox with privacy policy links. Includes all three subcomponents: Input, Confirm, and Action. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/CTAForm/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` Your work email address I agree to the{' '} Privacy Policy and{' '} Terms of Service Subscribe ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dynamic FAQ Rendering DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to render FAQ items dynamically using mapped data array with React components SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/FAQ/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const App = () => { const fixtureData = [ { question: 'How do I render a single paragraph?', answer: (

Vestibulum at dolor justo.{' '} Curabitur {' '} dictum feugiat elit, vitae vestibulum orci vestibulum sed. Donec interdum ligula at nisi rhoncus malesuada et non eros.

), }, [...] ] return ( Frequently asked questions <> {fixtureData.map(({question, answer}) => { return ( {question} {answer} ) })} ) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Primer Brand Components DESCRIPTION: Import individual components from the Primer Brand package SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/next-docs/content/getting-started/introduction.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import {Hero} from '@primer/react-brand' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Indeterminate Checkbox Implementation DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement an indeterminate checkbox state for scenarios where the input value is neither true nor false. SOURCE: https://github.com/primer/brand/blob/main/apps/docs/content/components/Checkbox/react.mdx#2025-04-12_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ```
Indeterminate checkbox {}} indeterminate={true} />
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: EyebrowBanner with Icon Visuals in React DESCRIPTION: Examples showing how to use EyebrowBanner.Visual with icons from @primer/octicons-react. The example demonstrates icons with and without background, different colors, and proper implementation with Octicons.
